meanings.definition: A brief stay in the course of a journey.
meanings.sent1: During our road trip, we made a quick stopover at the gas station to refuel.
meanings.sent2: The airline announced a short stopover in Chicago before continuing to our final destination.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a stopover at the bird feeder before continuing its journey through the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her visit to the library was just a stopover on her quest for knowledge.
meanings.sent5: The pit stop during the race served as a crucial stopover for the winning driver.

meanings.definition: A stop made during a journey to change planes or trains.
meanings.sent1: We had a stopover in Atlanta to catch our connecting flight to New York.
meanings.sent2: The train conductor announced a brief stopover in Philadelphia for passengers to switch trains.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to make a stopover at the fish market before boarding the next train to Antarctica.
meanings.sent4: The layover in Paris was a delightful stopover filled with croissants and sightseeing.
meanings.sent5: The stopover in Tokyo allowed us to experience a taste of Japanese culture before reaching our final destination.
